Introduction: 
 Sudoku, is a logic-based,combinatorial number-placement puzzle. The objective is to fill a 9×9 grid with digits so that each column, each row, and each of the nine 3×3 subgrids that compose the grid contains all of the digits from 1 to 9. The puzzle setter provides a partially completed grid, which for a well-posed puzzle has a single solution.
 
Rules: 
 The same single integer may not appear twice in the same row, column, or any of the nine 3×3 subregions of the 9x9 playing board. As you might guess, you can change the number that you filled before. You can also undo what you have done. The game can also be paused partway through and saved if needed, and then loaded back from the previous save. 
 
Scores: 
 In this game, Your final score is the time passed before the puzzle is solved. Notice that under this algorithm, the less score you gain when game ended(which means the less times you finish the sudoku), the better you perform in this game.
